object: Channel 2 is their location, Channel 3 is emergency - Colored labels on channel knob positions - Managers get the "ALL LOCATIONS" zone with full access - **Lock out VFO/frequency entry** to prevent accidental reprogramming - Use **channel alias names** (not numbers) on display radios ---
source_context:
1 is always dispatch, Channel 2 is their location, Channel 3 is emergency
- Colored labels on channel knob positions
- Managers get the "ALL LOCATIONS" zone with full access
- **Lock out VFO/frequency entry** to prevent accidental reprogramming
- Use **channel alias names** (not numbers) on display radios

subject: backups
object: NOT connected to infected network | | **POS/credit card breach** | Isolate the CDE network segment, notify payment processor, do NOT process cards at affected location (switch to manual imprint if needed) | | **Phishing with credential theft** | Reset compromised credentials, check O365 audit log for inbox rule changes and mail forwarding, revoke OAuth tokens | | **Physical break-in** | Secure the location, call law enforcement, review camera footage, change access codes/re-key if needed |
source_context:
backups are intact and NOT connected to infected network |
| **POS/credit card breach** | Isolate the CDE network segment, notify payment processor, do NOT process cards at affected location (switch to manual imprint if needed) |
| **Phishing with credential theft** | Reset compromised credentials, check O365 audit log for inbox rule changes and mail forwarding, revoke OAuth tokens |
| **Physical break-in** | Secure the location, call law enforcement, review camera footage, change access codes/re-key if needed |

subject: imaging
object: with potential litigation), do NOT attempt in-house — engage a forensic firm - Document every action taken with timestamps in the GLPI incident ticket

imaging is needed (SEV-1 with potential litigation), do NOT attempt in-house — engage a forensic firm
- Document every action taken with timestamps in the GLPI incident ticket

subject: Directory
object: KRBTGT (twice, 12 hours apart), reset all admin passwords, review all GPOs for tampering - For phishing: block sender domain, add to O365 tenant block list, remove emails from all mailboxes using Content Search purge - Update firewall rules to block attacker IPs/domains - If a vendor/third-party was the vector: suspend their access pending investigation
source_context:
Directory is compromised: reset KRBTGT (twice, 12 hours apart), reset all admin passwords, review all GPOs for tampering
- For phishing: block sender domain, add to O365 tenant block list, remove emails from all mailboxes using Content Search purge
- Update firewall rules to block attacker IPs/domains
- If a vendor/third-party was the vector: suspend their access pending investigation

subject: PCI
object: | **No active response, only alerting** | "We'll tell you about threats" ≠ "We'll stop threats" — big difference | | **Pricing based on log volume (EPS)** | Unpredictable costs; per-endpoint is better for budgeting | | **3-year minimum contract with no out** | Too risky for a new offering (launched 2024) | | **Long onboarding (>60 days)** | Suggests complexity or resource constraints | | **Can't provide customer references** | Partnership is only ~2 years old — limited track record | | **No direct Proficio SOC access** | If RapidScale is just a middleman adding latency to incident response | | **Requires rip-and-replace of existing security tools** | Should integrate with what you have | | **Won't provide sample reports or dashboards** | You can't evaluate what you can't see |
source_context:
PCI is non-negotiable |
| **No active response, only alerting** | "We'll tell you about threats" ≠ "We'll stop threats" — big difference |
| **Pricing based on log volume (EPS)** | Unpredictable costs; per-endpoint is better for budgeting |
| **3-year minimum contract with no out** | Too risky for a new offering (launched 2024) |
| **Long onboarding (>60 days)** | Suggests complexity or resource constraints |
| **Can't provide customer references** | Partnership is only ~2 years old — limited track record |
| **No direct Proficio SOC access** | If RapidScale is just a middleman adding latency to incident response |
| **Requires rip-and-replace of existing security tools** | Should integrate with what you have |
| **Won't provide sample reports or dashboards** | You can't evaluate what you can't see |
